title: The elusive Mister Baines
content:
Hi everyone  
I’m quite a fan of Phil Baines’ work — as an author, a teacher and a graphic designer — and I recently read that he also designed several typefaces, some of which I already knew — Vere Dignum for Linotype, FF Can You for FontFont. Yet it appears that his typographic œuvre is wider than that and I wondered if anyone at Typophile had ever seen two other designs by Baines I’ve heard about, Toulon and Horncastle (both 1994).  
Thank you very much.

 [‹ Slab Serif Similar to SOHO](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031220004/http:/typophile.com/node/38605 "Go to previous forum topic") [Good, regularly-updated, cutting-edge design blogs? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071031220004/http:/typophile.com/node/38595 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Celeste

comments.content:
I remember calling fontshop about Toulon and finding out it was an early digital hybrid - not an original design.

What does Horncastle look like?
